byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: About 50 people are expected to be arrested in bribery scheme to facilitate New York City construction projects after lengthy investigation by Manhattan district attorney's office; defendants include building inspectors, contractors, property owners and so-called 'expediters.'
lead_paragraph: New York City building inspectors, property owners and private contractors are expected to be arrested on Tuesday in a scheme to speed up approval of construction projects.

headline.main: Dozens Expected to Be Charged in Construction Permit Plot
headline.print_headline: Dozens Expected to Be Charged in Construction Permit Plot

snippet: New York City building inspectors, property owners and private contractors are expected to be arrested on Tuesday in a scheme to speed up approval of construction projects.
